info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued August 4 at 3:01PM MDT until August 5 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne WY
info.description:
...MULTI-DAY CRITICAL FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED THIS WEEK WITH LITTLE OVERNIGHT RELIEF...
.A multi-day critical fire weather event is ongoing this week due to low RH values into the teens and single digits, alongside poor overnight recoveries and gusty winds. Overnight recoveries may rise a little higher or winds a bit less breezy on some days, but overall conditions will be poor for a majority of the week.
The National Weather Service in Cheyenne has issued a Red Flag Warning, which is in effect from noon to 6 PM MDT Tuesday.
* AFFECTED AREA...Fire weather zones 417 AND 418.
* WIND...Gusting 20-30 mph.
* HUMIDITY...10 to 15 percent.
* IMPACTS...any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.

parameter.value: RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 6 PM MDT TUESDAY FOR LOW RH AND GUSTY WINDS FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 417 AND 418

area.areaDesc: Niobrara/Lower Elevations of Converse/Thunder Basin National Grassland; Middle North Platte River Basin/Niobrara and Converse High Plains
